ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course? (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I learned more about Israeli art, culture, and literature. This course also deepened my understanding of how to analyze film, which I had done little of before this semester. In this course, you are expected to engage critically with the material and subject matters discussed, and this emboldened me to do external research on course materials.
Foundations in Israeli culture and literature.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved? (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments:
Strengths: This course is very well organized, clear, and enjoyable. Professor Goren is very upfront about what she expects from students and gives ample opportunity to improve your grade. The enrichment events were fun and deepened my understanding of topics we discussed in class without being repetitive or boring. The integration of new Israeli films and guest speakers made the class lively and entertaining. Being allowed to pick which events we went to meant that we could focus on subjects that interested us specifically, which made the course feel catered to my own preferences.
Weaknesses: I cannot think of any real weaknesses to the course, only that I wish we had more time to talk about some of the topics that we discussed in class.
This course has very interesting content and is structured brilliantly.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)

Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Absolutely. Israel will never cease to be a hot topic, and is almost always put in some sort of us-versus-them, good-versus-evil dynamic. Shiri's approach, in contrast, is much more nuanced, depicting Israeli Jews and Arabs as real people with perspectives worth listening to. I feel like I have a much richer understanding of the Conflict and Israeli society after taking the course, even though I had spent a considerable amount of time in Israel beforehand.

I would highly recommend this course to any student that wants to learn more about Israeli art and culture. The classes are fun and respectful, and Professor Goren really cultivates a constructive environment to talk about divisive issues.
Absolutely. This is a must-take for anyone who wants to truly understand Israel, particularly in a time when so many of its politics require cultural and sociological contextualization.

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: We were required to attend and write about a series of virtual talks occurring during the months of February and March.
